Description: Pottery amphora (wine-jar) with two handles and a tall cylindrical neck with a modelled rim. The exterior surface bears a cream slip, and two lines of hieratic text on the surface.
Curator's comments: For similar amphorae from Tell el-Amarna, see P. Rose, The Eighteenth Dynasty Pottery Corpus from Amarna (MEES 83, London, 2007): 128-9, 273 [esp. 589]. Rose notes that hieratic labels are not uncommon on these types of jars, with some also having handles stamped with the production estate. For hieratic inscription cf. Dept. Conservation photo 1930/4 [of 22.08.2001] Published: Hope, Pottery of the Egyptian New Kingdom, (1989), p.102.
